children.text: Select the correct passive form of the given sentence: She has designed some beautiful dresses.

options: Some beautiful dresses are being designed by her.
Some beautiful dresses has been designed by her.
Some beautiful dresses have been designed by her.
Some beautiful dresses were designed by her.

children.text: Select the correct active form of the given sentence: Were have those important documents been hidden by you?

options: Where are you hiding those important documents?
Where did you hide those important documents?
Where do you hide those important documents?
Where have you hidden those important documents?

children.text: Select the correct passive form of the given sentence: The soldiers are digging a deep trench.

options: A deep trench is dug by the soldiers.
A deep trench is being dug by the soldiers.
A deep trench is digging by the soldiers.
A deep trench was being dug by the soldiers.

children.text: Identify the segment in the sentence which contains the grammatical error: Opening the door of the cage means free for the bird.
Identify the segment in the sentence which contains the grammatical error: The bus was so late then I thought I would miss the show.
Select the correct indirect form of the given sentence: The manager said, “My secretary has resigned.”

options: The manager said that his secretary has resign.
The manager said that my secretary had resigned.
The manager said that his secretary resigned.
The manager said that his secretary had resigned.

children.text: Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank: This tree no longer bears ____ fruit.
Identify the segment in the sentence which contains the grammatical error: I have acquire a feeling of self-confidence and courage.
Select the correct indirect form of the given sentence: Mother said to him, “How did you get the tickets to the show?”

options: Mother asked him that how had he got the tickets to the show.
Mother asked him how he had got the tickets to the show.
Mother asked him that how he get the tickets to the show.
Mother asked him how he got the tickets to the show.

children.text: Select the correct passive form of the given sentence: Children leave all kinds of things in the school.

options: All kinds of things have been left in the school by children.
All kinds of things are left in the school by children.
All kinds of things is left in the school by children.
All kinds of things are being left in the school by children.

children.text: Select the most appropriate antonym of the given word: RETRIEVE
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word: DEFECT
Select the correct direct form of the given sentence: The teacher commanded the students to keep quiet.

options: The teacher said to the students, “You should be quiet”
The teacher said, “Can you keep quiet, students?”
The teacher said to the students, “Keep quiet”
The teacher said, “Students, please keep quiet”

children.text: Select the correct active form of the given sentence: The meeting was postponed by a week.

options: They postponed the meeting by a week.
They are postponing the meeting by a week.
They have postponed the meeting by a week.
They will postpone the meeting by a week.

children.text: Select the most appropriate antonym of the given word: UNCOUTH
Select the most appropriate meaning of the underlined idiom in the given sentence: Raman is good at mathematics but geography is his Achilles’ heel.

Given below are four sentences, three of which are jumbled. Pick the option that gives the correct order: A. I learned to push Lily's wheelchair. B. It was fun to watch Lily roll her eyes to watch the ducks. C. I parked the chair in front of the pond. D. One afternoon, I wheeled her to the park.
Select the correct indirect form of the given sentence: She said, “These vegetables do not look fresh.”

options: She said that these vegetables do not look fresh.
She said that those vegetables did not look fresh.
She said that these vegetables did not look fresh.
She said that those vegetables did not looked fresh.

children.text: Identify the segment in the sentence which contains the grammatical error: Several stone pillars were erected by the reign of Ashoka.
Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to substitute it, select ‘No substitution.’ Alas! Don’t make a noise in the library.
Select the correct indirect form of the given sentence: The captain announced, “The aircraft will take off soon.”

options: The captain announced that the aircraft would take off soon.
The captain announced that the aircraft will take off soon.
The captain announced that the aircraft will be taking off soon.
The captain announces the aircraft would take off soon.

children.text: Select the correct indirect form of the given sentence: Maria said to me, “Are you a lawyer?”

options: Maria asked me if I was a lawyer.
Maria said to me if you were a lawyer.
Maria asked me that was I a lawyer?
Maria asked me that if I were a lawyer.

children.text: Select the correct direct form of the given sentence: Shilpi requested her father to let her join the school trip to Ooty the following week.

options: Shilpi said to her father, “I want to join the school trip to Ooty next week.”
Shilpi said to her father, “Will you let me join the school trip to Ooty the following week?”
Shilpi said to her father, “Please let me to join the school trip to Ooty the following week.”
Shilpi said to her father, “Please let me join the school trip to Ooty next week.”

children.text: Given below are four sentences, three of which are jumbled. Pick the option that gives the correct order: A. I knew it had not been a good idea to invite Vandana home. B. And, I wasn't particularly keen to reveal my whole life to her. C. As soon as she entered my room, she zoomed in on the collage on the wall. D. The collage was actually my life in pictures.

options: The batsmen are scoring a lot of runs.
The batsmen scored a lot of runs.
The batsmen have been scoring a lot of runs.
The batsmen are going to score a lot of runs.

options: The house has been guarded by a fierce-looking dog.
The house is being guarded by a fierce-looking dog.
The house was guarded by a fierce-looking dog.
The house is guarded by a fierce-looking dog.

children.text: Select the correct passive form of the given sentence: The government will soon announce the dates for the cricket tournament.

options: The dates for the cricket tournament will soon be announced by the government.
The dates for the cricket tournament will be soon announced by the government.
The dates for the cricket tournament are soon being announced by the government.
The dates for the cricket tournament are soon to be announced by the government.

children.text: Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence: The burglar used the ladder that was lying in the courtyard.

options: He said, "Ah! How careless I have been!"
He said, "Alas, how careless I have been!"
He said, "Oh, I am so careless."

Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank No. 7.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank No. 8.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank No. 9.

children.text: Why did the villagers want the soldiers to come back again?

options: They were afraid of the enemies.
They wanted clothes and other stuff.

children.text: The narrator was not with his family at Christmas because:

options: the snow had blocked the roads
he was going to an orphanage

children.text: Initially, the adults were not as friendly as the children because:

options: they did not want to celebrate Christmas
they did not trust the soldiers
they were not interested in gifts

children.text: Which of these statements is NOT true?

options: It was the narrator's first Christmas away from home.
The villagers wanted only gifts from the soldiers.
The village had been reduced to a camp for destitute families.
Children were excited to meet the soldiers.

children.text: Which of these statements does NOT indicate that the drive to the village was dangerous?

options: The orphanage village was not well-known.
There was heavy snowfall on the hills.
The snow was beating against the vehicles.

options: accepts food that is handed out
looks handsome with an orange beak

What is the theme of the passage?

options: Survival of the birds in cities

options: finds a table at a restaurant

children.text: 'Canine partner' refers to:

options: A person who is a walking partner

Which of these statements is NOT true?

options: The narrator is grateful to The Seeing Eye organisation.

options: The importance of Seeing Eye dogs
